ha land, open vr scene, skeletons move 1 frame per second, crystal sword
Make sure everything is in a single HTML file with embedded CSS and JS in a single code block to be used as a web app.

Creating a simple VR scene with moving skeletons and a crystal sword in a single HTML file can be done using the A-Frame framework, which is a web framework for building virtual reality experiences. Below is an example of how you can set this up. 

This code will create a basic VR scene where skeletons move slowly, and a crystal sword is placed in the scene. You can view this by saving the code in an HTML file and opening it in a web browser that supports WebVR.

```html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>VR Scene with Skeletons and Crystal Sword</title>
    <script src="https://aframe.io/releases/1.2.0/aframe.min.js"></script>
    <style>
        body { margin: 0; }
        a-scene { height: 100vh; }
        .sword { color: cyan; }
    </style>
</head>
<body>
    <a-scene>
        <a-assets>
            <a-entity id="skeleton1" gltf-model="https://cdn.glitch.global/123456/skeleton.glb"></a-entity>
            <a-entity id="skeleton2" gltf-model="https://cdn.glitch.global/123456/skeleton.glb"></a-entity>
            <a-entity id="sword" geometry="primitive: box; height: 1; width: 0.1; depth: 0.1" material="color: cyan;"></a-entity>
        </a-assets>

        <a-entity camera look-controls position="0 1.6 0"></a-entity>
        <a-light type="ambient" color="#FFF"></a-light>
        <a-light type="directional" position="-1 1 1" intensity="0.5"></a-light>

        <a-entity id="skeleton1" position="-1 0 -3" animation="property: position; to: -1 0 -2; dir: alternate; dur: 1000; loop: true"></a-entity>
        <a-entity id="skeleton2" position="1 0 -3" animation="property: position; to: 1 0 -2; dir: alternate; dur: 1000; loop: true"></a-entity>

        <a-entity id="sword" position="0 0 -2" rotation="0 0 0" scale="1 1 1"></a-entity>
    </a-scene>

    <script>
        // Optional: Add any additional JavaScript functionality here
    </script>
</body>
</html>
```

### Explanation:
- **A-Frame**: This framework is included via a CDN link, allowing you to create 3D and VR experiences easily.
- **Assets**: The skeleton models are referenced as GLTF models. You will need to replace the URLs with actual paths to your skeleton models.
- **Animation**: The skeletons are animated to move back and forth using the `animation` component.
- **Crystal Sword**: A simple box geometry is used to represent the sword, colored cyan to give it a crystal-like appearance.
- **Camera and Lights**: A camera is added for the user to look around, and ambient and directional lights are included to illuminate the scene.

### Note:
- Make sure to replace the skeleton model URLs with actual GLTF model URLs that you have access to.
- This code is a basic example and can be expanded with more features and enhancements as needed.
